segment.source: Smart cards
segment.target: Smart cards

segment.source: This topic explains how Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps can use smart cards to connect users to secure network services, including how to access physical smart card readers, create virtual smart cards, communicate with smart cards, authenticate users, reset user PINs, and remove or disconnect smart cards.
segment.target: This topic explains how Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps can use smart cards to connect users to secure network services, including how to access physical smart card readers, create virtual smart cards, communicate with smart cards, authenticate users, reset user PINs, and remove or disconnect smart cards.

segment.source: Smart cards
segment.target: Smart cards

segment.source: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.
segment.target: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.

segment.source: For Windows 8.x articles, see the archive \]
segment.target: For Windows 8.x articles, see the archive \]

segment.source: This topic explains how Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps can use smart cards to connect users to secure network services, including how to access physical smart card readers, create virtual smart cards, communicate with smart cards, authenticate users, reset user PINs, and remove or disconnect smart cards.
segment.target: This topic explains how Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps can use smart cards to connect users to secure network services, including how to access physical smart card readers, create virtual smart cards, communicate with smart cards, authenticate users, reset user PINs, and remove or disconnect smart cards.

segment.source: Configure the app manifest
segment.target: Configure the app manifest

segment.source: Before your app can authenticate users using smart cards or virtual smart cards, you must set the Shared User Certificates capability in the project Package.appxmanifest file.
segment.target: Before your app can authenticate users using smart cards or virtual smart cards, you must set the Shared User Certificates capability in the project Package.appxmanifest file.

segment.source: Access connected card readers and smart cards
segment.target: Access connected card readers and smart cards

segment.source: You can query for readers and attached smart cards by passing the device ID (specified in DeviceInformation) to the SmartCardReader.FromIdAsync method.
segment.target: You can query for readers and attached smart cards by passing the device ID (specified in DeviceInformation) to the SmartCardReader.FromIdAsync method.

segment.source: To access the smart cards currently attached to the returned reader device, call SmartCardReader.FindAllCardsAsync.
segment.target: To access the smart cards currently attached to the returned reader device, call SmartCardReader.FindAllCardsAsync.

segment.source: You should also enable your app to observe for CardAdded events by implementing a method to handle app behavior on card insertion.
segment.target: You should also enable your app to observe for CardAdded events by implementing a method to handle app behavior on card insertion.

segment.source: You can then pass each returned SmartCard object to SmartCardProvisioning to access the methods that allow your app to access and customize its configuration.
segment.target: You can then pass each returned SmartCard object to SmartCardProvisioning to access the methods that allow your app to access and customize its configuration.

segment.source: Create a virtual smart card
segment.target: Create a virtual smart card

segment.source: To create a virtual smart card using SmartCardProvisioning, your app will first need to provide a friendly name, an admin key, and a SmartCardPinPolicy.
segment.target: To create a virtual smart card using SmartCardProvisioning, your app will first need to provide a friendly name, an admin key, and a SmartCardPinPolicy.

segment.source: The friendly name is generally something provided to the app, but your app will still need to provide an admin key and generate an instance of the current SmartCardPinPolicy before passing all three values to RequestVirtualSmartCardCreationAsync.
segment.target: The friendly name is generally something provided to the app, but your app will still need to provide an admin key and generate an instance of the current SmartCardPinPolicy before passing all three values to RequestVirtualSmartCardCreationAsync.

segment.source: Create a new instance of a SmartCardPinPolicy
segment.target: Create a new instance of a SmartCardPinPolicy

segment.source: Generate the admin key value by calling CryptographicBuffer.GenerateRandom on the admin key value provided by the service or management tool.
segment.target: Generate the admin key value by calling CryptographicBuffer.GenerateRandom on the admin key value provided by the service or management tool.

segment.source: Pass these values along with the FriendlyNameText string to RequestVirtualSmartCardCreationAsync.
segment.target: Pass these values along with the FriendlyNameText string to RequestVirtualSmartCardCreationAsync.

segment.source: Once RequestVirtualSmartCardCreationAsync has returned the associated SmartCardProvisioning object, the virtual smart card is provisioned and ready for use.
segment.target: Once RequestVirtualSmartCardCreationAsync has returned the associated SmartCardProvisioning object, the virtual smart card is provisioned and ready for use.

segment.source: Handle authentication challenges
segment.target: Handle authentication challenges

segment.source: To authenticate with smart cards or virtual smart cards, your app must provide the behavior to complete challenges between the admin key data stored on the card, and the admin key data maintained by the authentication server or management tool.
segment.target: To authenticate with smart cards or virtual smart cards, your app must provide the behavior to complete challenges between the admin key data stored on the card, and the admin key data maintained by the authentication server or management tool.

segment.source: The following code shows how to support smart card authentication for services or modification of physical or virtual card details.
segment.target: The following code shows how to support smart card authentication for services or modification of physical or virtual card details.

segment.source: If the data generated using the admin key on the card ("challenge") is the same as the admin key data provided by the server or management tool ("adminkey"), authentication is successful.
segment.target: If the data generated using the admin key on the card ("challenge") is the same as the admin key data provided by the server or management tool ("adminkey"), authentication is successful.

segment.source: You will see this code referenced throughout the remainder of this topic was we review how to complete an authentication action, and how to apply changes to smart card and virtual smart card information.
segment.target: You will see this code referenced throughout the remainder of this topic was we review how to complete an authentication action, and how to apply changes to smart card and virtual smart card information.

segment.source: Verify smart card or virtual smart card authentication response
segment.target: Verify smart card or virtual smart card authentication response

segment.source: Now that we have the logic for authentication challenges defined, we can communicate with the reader to access the smart card, or alternatively, access a virtual smart card for authentication.
segment.target: Now that we have the logic for authentication challenges defined, we can communicate with the reader to access the smart card, or alternatively, access a virtual smart card for authentication.

segment.source: To begin the challenge, call GetChallengeContextAsync from the SmartCardProvisioning object associated with the smart card.
segment.target: To begin the challenge, call GetChallengeContextAsync from the SmartCardProvisioning object associated with the smart card.

segment.source: This will generate an instance of SmartCardChallengeContext, which contains the card's Challenge value.
segment.target: This will generate an instance of SmartCardChallengeContext, which contains the card's Challenge value.

segment.source: Next, pass the card's challenge value and the admin key provided by the service or management tool to the ChallengeResponseAlgorithm that we defined in the previous example.
segment.target: Next, pass the card's challenge value and the admin key provided by the service or management tool to the ChallengeResponseAlgorithm that we defined in the previous example.

segment.source: VerifyResponseAsync will return true if authentication is successful.
segment.target: VerifyResponseAsync will return true if authentication is successful.

segment.source: Change or reset a user PIN
segment.target: Change or reset a user PIN

segment.source: To change the PIN associated with a smart card:
segment.target: To change the PIN associated with a smart card:

segment.source: Access the card and generate the associated SmartCardProvisioning object.
segment.target: Access the card and generate the associated SmartCardProvisioning object.

segment.source: Call RequestPinChangeAsync to display a UI to the user to complete this operation.
segment.target: Call RequestPinChangeAsync to display a UI to the user to complete this operation.

segment.source: If the PIN was successfully changed the call will return true.
segment.target: If the PIN was successfully changed the call will return true.

segment.source: To request a PIN reset:
segment.target: To request a PIN reset:

segment.source: Call RequestPinResetAsync to initiate the operation.
segment.target: Call RequestPinResetAsync to initiate the operation.

segment.source: This call includes a SmartCardPinResetHandler method that represents the smart card and the pin reset request.
segment.target: This call includes a SmartCardPinResetHandler method that represents the smart card and the pin reset request.

segment.source: SmartCardPinResetHandler provides information that our ChallengeResponseAlgorithm, wrapped in a SmartCardPinResetDeferral call, uses to compare the card's challenge value and the admin key provided by the service or management tool to authenticate the request.
segment.target: SmartCardPinResetHandler provides information that our ChallengeResponseAlgorithm, wrapped in a SmartCardPinResetDeferral call, uses to compare the card's challenge value and the admin key provided by the service or management tool to authenticate the request.

segment.source: If the challenge is successful, the RequestPinResetAsync call is completed; returning true if the PIN was successfully reset.
segment.target: If the challenge is successful, the RequestPinResetAsync call is completed; returning true if the PIN was successfully reset.

segment.source: Remove a smart card or virtual smart card
segment.target: Remove a smart card or virtual smart card

segment.source: When a physical smart card is removed a CardRemoved event will fire when the card is deleted.
segment.target: When a physical smart card is removed a CardRemoved event will fire when the card is deleted.

segment.source: Associate the firing of this event with the card reader with the method that defines your app's behavior on card or reader removal as an event handler.
segment.target: Associate the firing of this event with the card reader with the method that defines your app's behavior on card or reader removal as an event handler.

segment.source: This behavior can be something as simply as providing notification to the user that the card was removed.
segment.target: This behavior can be something as simply as providing notification to the user that the card was removed.

segment.source: The removal of a virtual smart card is handled programmatically by first retrieving the card and then calling RequestVirtualSmartCardDeletionAsync from the SmartCardProvisioning returned object.
segment.target: The removal of a virtual smart card is handled programmatically by first retrieving the card and then calling RequestVirtualSmartCardDeletionAsync from the SmartCardProvisioning returned object.
